title: Steering Head Bearing - Check

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and support the motorcycle so that the front wheel is clear of the ground.
Move the handlebars from lock-to-lock whilst checking for signs of tight spots or notchiness (bearings overtightened).
Hold the lower end of the front forks and try to move them forward and backward to check for signs of free play in the bearings (bearings insufficiently tightened or worn).

body.name: Steering Head Bearing Check (DD2 Steering Head Check)

body.body: Checking for Free Play in Steering Head Bearings
then lower the motorcycle to the ground.
